page.title: 11Portrait of a farm(NUMBER 3)
page.content: This is Newbold Grounds Farm,in the N.of our block.Its 151 acres are almost all in the block.It is all arable land. This area was known as 'Little Wales'up till 1946,because all the tenant farmers were Welsh.Cattle were transported from Mid Wales to be fattened here.(There was good grassland based on the heavy clay soils,worn from the underlying ironstone) After 1946, potatoes were no.1 crop but waterlogged soils made harvesting difficult.Now the accent is on wheat and barley,both sown in Autumn.Peas,tic beans and oilseed rape are all grown for cattle feed.The tic beans are sent to a kibling mill,to be 'kibbled'.Oilseed rape is quite a modern crop.It was once left to grow un picked,for sheep to feed on, because it was thought that the crop would not ripen in this country.
